title: ProLinked
headline: A PHP social network
desc: In order to materialize the idea of two business school students, I initially realized a pre-launch page of the service. Subsequently, I was able to create an authentication system (registration, login, profile management) combined with a system of SMS verification and automated e-mail sending.

title: Stock Manager
headline: An AngularJs Webapp
desc: Having contributed to a Hackathon organized by Epitech, my role was to create a tool to facilitate the management of stock within a fire station. With this solution, the user can dynamically add and remove an object from a database and have an overview of the current stock.

title: Sochic Bijoux
headline: A PHP E-commerce platform
desc: The first part of my 2nd year internship at EPITECH consisted of optimizing the daily update of elements in a database. Subsequently, I was able to completely rebuild an e-commerce website. The front end includes authentication, display of products in their categories, presentation of a retail item, addition to the shopping cart and integration of a payment module. For the back-end part, I was able to develop a module for generating invoices and a voucher system, allowing to change the status of orders made on the site (sent / paid / shipped)
